page.title: 02RELIGION IN LEOMINSTER
page.content: The Priory Church, the Church of St Peter and St Paul. The foundation of the church goes back to 660 A.D. Ealfred a Northumbrian missionary was the first Abbot. The oldest part of the present church was built by Norman Monks in 1130. The Central Nave was added in 1239 and the South Aisle in 1320. All that remains of this great church is the Naves. The East end, including the choir,chapels,transepts and central towers were pulled down at the Reformation in 1539. Since then it has served as the parish church and is part of our national heritage. The Roman Catholics,Baptists, Methodists, Brethren and Apostolics have their Churches and Chapels too. Grange Court was built by John Abel in 1633 in the centre of the town. This elegant building now adorns the Grange, being removed there in 1854.
